response: "{ \"title\": \"Medium: Maximum Sum of Subarray\", \"description\": \"Given an array of integers, find the maximum sum of a subarray. A subarray is a contiguous part of the array. For example, if we have the array [2, 1, 5, -2, 3, 1], the maximum sum of a subarray would be 7, which can be achieved by taking the subarray [2, 1, 5].\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef max_sum_subarray(arr: list[int)) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the maximum sum of a subarray.\", \"code\": \"\\ndef max_sum_subarray(arr: list[int)) -> int:\\n    n = len(arr)\\n    max_sum = float('-inf')\\n    current_sum = 0\\n\\n    for i in range(n):\\n        current_sum += arr[i]\\n        if current_sum > max_sum:\\n            max_sum = current_sum\\n        if current_sum < 0:\\n            current_sum = 0\\n\\n    return max_sum\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert max_sum_subarray([2, 1, 5, -2, 3, 1]) == 7\", \"assert max_sum_subarray([-2, 1, -3, 4, -1, 2, 1, -5, 4]) == 6\"] }"
